info.description:
API for submitting lease applications and processing leases. Take a look at the flow diagram for an overview of the lease application and lease process flow.

Quick Start

Authentication

Authentication for the Acima Credit API is managed via "per-location" tokens.
  • During on-boarding, we will work with you to determine what the best approach is for generating and providing an initial set of access tokens.
  • Based on the onboarding discussion, we can work with you to provide an ongoing strategy for generating new (and refreshing existing tokens, if needed).

GET an OAuth Access Token

curl -X GET "http://35.162.215.56/oauth/token" -H  "accept: application/json" -d client_secret="{SECRET_API_KEY}"

GET a Lease Agreement

curl -X GET "https://35.162.215.56/api/v1/lease_application/1" -H  "accept: application/json"

GET a Lease

curl -X GET "curl -X GET "https://35.162.215.56/api/v1/lease/1" -H  "accept: application/json"
info.title: Acima Credit Lease API

tags.name: lease application
tags.description: Use the Lease Application API to submit customer applications for consideration. Submit and update new lease applications; check the status of previously submitted applications.

tags.name: lease
tags.description: Upon successful approval and acceptance of a Lease Application, use the Lease API to interact with a customer's lease. Submit and update invoices, delivery confirmation notices; check the status of previously submitted items.

put.description:
Update an existing lease.  The exact kind of update is controlled via the action request parameter.

Supported Actions:
  * __generate_docs__ - Generates the lease documents for review and signing.  This action is only available after the merchant invoice has been submitted.  Only the id field is required in the lease object parameter.
  * __request_signature__ - Sends a signature request to the applicant.  The request will be sent to their email, and an SMS message will be sent to their phone number.
  * __confirm_delivery__ - Used to indicate that the goods or services have been delivered and received by the applicant(s).
  * __undo_generate_docs__ - Moves the lease back to the pending_invoice state, allowing the invoice data to be updated.
  * __undo_acceptance__ - Reverts the lease back to a lease application, allowing the lease application and applicant data to be updated.

parameters.name: lease
parameters.description: The lease to update.  The id is required, and __MUST__ match the id in the URL.  Other required data depends on the action.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to take on the lease application.

200.description: The lease application was accepted by the system and updated.  The lease application is returned with the latest data.

400.description: The action parameter is invalid, or the id in the URL does not match the id in the lease body

422.description: The lease is missing required information, or contains incorrectly formatted data.  The extra field in the response object will contain the lease application object, as received in the request.

get.summary: Get the delivery confirmation for the lease
get.description: Retrieves the delivery confirmation for the lease.  Returns status 404 if a delivery confirmation has not been saved yet.

404.description: Returned if the lease id is invalid, or a delivery confirmation has not been saved yet

put.summary: Saves a delivery confirmation for a lease
put.description:
Currently this endpoint only supports the save action action. 
Supported Actions:
  * __save__ - Saves a delivery confirmation to the lease.  Checks the delivery confirmation to make sure all required information is entered and valid.  If the check succeeds, the delivery confirmation is saved to the lease.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to take on the delivery confirmation

200.description: The delivery confirmation was accepted and saved by the system.  The delivery confirmation is returned with the latest data.

400.description: The action parameter is invalid, or the id in the URL does not match the id in the delivery confirmation body

422.description: The delivery confirmation is missing required information, or contains incorrectly formatted data.  The extra field in the response object will contain the delivery confirmation object, as received in the request.

get.summary: Get the invoice for the lease
get.description:
Retrieves the merchant invoice for the lease.  Until the first save operation on the invoice, calls to this endpoint return a "template" invoice that is populated with data relevant to the merchant.  After a successful save operation, it returns the persisted invoice.

A "template" invoice has  the following fields populated: 
  - max_lease_amount - The same value as the max_approved_amount in the lease
  - initial_payment - The initial payment amount
  - merchant_invoice_total - Initialized to zero
  - amount_collected - Initialized to zero
  - simple_invoice_total - The initial_payment value
  - additional_down_payment - Initialized to zero
  - tax - Initialized to the amount levied against the initial payment, if applicable, or zero
  - final_lease_amount - Initialized to zero

put.summary: Re-calculate (without saving), or save an invoice
put.description:
Use the action parameter to either re-calculate an invoice without saving it, or save the invoice.
Supported Actions:
  * __recalc__ - Recalculates the amounts of an invoice.  The values of some fields are dependent on values of others.  Use this endpoint to obtain the latest values of these dependent fields.
  * __save__ - Saves an invoice to the lease.  Checks the invoice to make sure all required information is entered and valid.  If the check succeeds, the invoice is saved to the lease and the lease status is updated.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to take on the invoice

200.description: The invoice was accepted by the system, and recalculated or saved.  The invoice is returned with the latest data.

400.description: The action parameter is invalid, or the id in the URL does not match the id in the lease body

422.description: The invoice is missing required information, or contains incorrectly formatted data.  The extra field in the response object will contain the invoice object, as received in the request.

post.description: Submits a new lease application.  The application must be populated with the minimum set of required data to be accepted.  If accepted, the returned object will be populated with an ID, and status.  In most cases the status will be "processing", and the consumer of the API should query for the latest status by calling the "Get Lease Application" endpoint with the returned ID.

201.description: The lease application was accepted by the system and created.  The lease application is returned with the ID and status fields populated.

Location.description: The path to the newly created lease application

422.description: The lease application is missing required information, or contains incorrectly formatted data.  The extra field in the response object will contain the lease application object, as received in the request.

get.description: Retrieves the disclosures that should be presented to the applicant at the beginning of the lease application process.  There is only one set of disclosures at this time.

parameters.name: If-Modified-Since
parameters.description: An optional timestamp parameter (RFC 1123 format) that can be used to skip the response body if the lease application disclosures have not been updated since the specified date.

304.description: The lease application disclosures have not been modified since the date supplied in the If-Modified-Since header

get.description: Retrieves a lease application by id

parameters.name: leaseApplicationId
parameters.description: The id of the lease application

parameters.name: If-Modified-Since
parameters.description: An optional timestamp parameter (RFC 1123 format) that can be used to skip the response body if the lease application has not been updated since the specified date.

304.description: The lease application has not been modified since the date supplied in the If-Modified-Since header

put.description:
Update an existing lease application.  The exact kind of update is controlled via the action request parameter.

Supported Actions:
  * __correct__ - Updates the information in a submitted lease application.
  * __set_approval_acceptance__ - Updates the applicant's acceptance decision on an approved lease application.  The applicant(s) can either accept or reject the offer.  On acceptance a the approval_accepted_at field is populated and a new lease is created from the lease application.  The id of the lease is returned in the lease application record as the lease_id property. Any further work should be performed against the lease.

parameters.name: leaseApplicationId
parameters.description: The id of the lease application

parameters.name: leaseApplication
parameters.description: The lease application.  The id is required, and __MUST__ match the id in the URL.  Other required data depends on the action.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to take on the lease application.

200.description: The lease application was accepted by the system and updated.  The lease application is returned with the latest data.

400.description: The action parameter is invalid, or the id in the URL does not match the id in the lease application body

422.description: The lease application is missing required information, or contains incorrectly formatted data.  The extra field in the response object will contain the lease application object, as received in the request.

address_2.description: Second line of the applicant's street address, if necessary.

alt_phone.description: Alternate phone number for the applicant.  Must be at least 10 digits. Normal phone punctuation is acceptable if formatted.

dl_state.description: Applicant's driver's license state abbreviation.  Must be a valid state abbreviation.

employment_1.description: Information about the applicant's primary or first job.

employment_2.description: Information about the applicant's second job

main_phone.description: Phone number for the applicant.  Must be at least 10 digits. Normal phone punctuation is acceptable if formatted.

zip.description: Applicant's address zip.  Must be 5 or 9 digits only.

Lease Applicant.description: An applicant for a lease.  Contains information that uniquely identifies an individual applying for a lease.  Includes, name, SSN and bank information.

lease_id.description: The id of the lease that this invoice belongs to

max_lease_amount.description: The maximum allowed lease amount.  This is the same value as the approved amount of the lease

description.description: A description of the goods and/or services

damaged.description: Are any of the goods damaged?

damages_description.description: Description of damages if any.  Required when damaged is set to true.  Disallowed when damaged is set to false

merchant_invoice_total.description: The total amount invoiced for goods and/or services by the merchant (Note: Depending on jurisdiction this amount may or may not include sales tax)

amount_collected.description: The amount collected from the customer by the merchant.  This amount must be enough to cover the initial payment, and if applicable, any taxes levied against the initial payment

simple_invoice_total.description: The total amount invoiced to the customer by Simple Finance.  This is the merchant invoice total plus the initial payment

initial_payment.description: Initial payment, also known as the processing fee.

additional_down_payment.description: The amount of additional down payment on the lease being made by the customer.  This field is calculated by using amount_collected and subtracting the initial payment and tax amounts.When the customer

tax.description: The taxes levied against the initial payment, and down payment, if any.  This amount may be zero in some jurisdictions.

final_lease_amount.description: The simple_invoice_amount minus initial_payment and additional_down_payment, if any

Invoice.description: Contains information about the goods and/or services received by the customer from the merchant, and the total amounts charged for those goods an/or services, sales tax and the amount collected from the customer.

created_at.description: The time at which this lease was created

updated_at.description: The time at which this lease was last updated

correlation_id.description: An optional unique identifier supplied by the API consumer when submitting a lease application, that can be used to correlate the lease application and lease with data in an external system.

lease_application_id.description: The id of the lease application that instigated this lease

status.description:
The status of the lease. The following status may be reported:
  * __approval_accepted__ - The customer has accepted the approved lease application
  * __lease_docs_created__ - The merchant invoice has been uploaded and the lease documents have been generated and awaiting the customer's signature
  * __awaiting_delivery__ - The customer has signed the lease documents, and the lease is awaiting delivery confirmation
  * __awaiting_funding_conditions__ - The merchant has indicated that delivery is complete, but there are other funding conditions that need to be met
  * __awaiting_funding__ - Awaiting funding
  * __funded__ - The lease has been funded
  * __canceled__ - The lease was canceled
  * __expired__ - The lease has expired

status_message.description: An optional message further describing the status of the lease application.

applicant_1.description: The primary individual applying for a lease.

reference_1.description: The first reference for the applicant(s)

reference_2.description: The second reference for the applicant(s)

routing_number.description: Applicant's or applicants' bank account routing number.  Must be a valid 9-digit routing number

account_number.description: Applicant's or applicants' checking account routing number.  This must be a checking account.  Savings and other types of accounts are not acceptable.  Must be between 3 and 16 digits

account_type.description: Applicant's or applicants' bank account type.  The only valid type is "checking".

auto_approved_amount.description: The amount the applicant(s) has been approved for on a lease.

conditional_approved_amount.description: An amount greater than the auto_approved_amount that the applicant(s) has been conditionally approved for, pending additional underwriting items are provided by the applicant.

lease_docs_url.description: The URL to the docs for this lease.  The docs are only available after they've been generated.

lease_docs_signed_date.description: The date and time the lease document was signed by the applicant.

Lease.description: Contains information about the customer (or customers), merchant invoice and  status and other lease details.  A lease is generated from a lease application on acceptance by the applicant(s).

disclosure_text.example: The text of the lease application disclosures

content_type.description: The media type of the disclosure text

created_at.description: The time at which the disclosures were initially created

updated_at.description: The time at which the disclosures were last updated

Lease Application Disclosures.description: The disclosures that should be shown or read to an applicant before starting the lease application process.

id.description: The id of the lease application

created_at.description: The time at which this lease application was created

updated_at.description: The time at which this lease application was last updated

correlation_id.description: An optional unique identifier supplied by the API consumer, that can be used to correlate the lease application to an external system.  If a value is supplied, it must be unique within the scope of the merchant.  The value will be copied to the resulting lease, once the lease application is accepted by the applicant, allowing both lease applications and leases to be retrieved.

status.description:
The status of a submitted lease application. The following status values may be reported:

  * __processing__ - The application is being evaluated
  * __see_portal__ - There is a problem with the application.  See the Portal application for details
  * __approved_with_conditions__ - The application is conditionally approved, and some conditions still need to be satisfied
  * __approved__ - The application is approved
  * __denied__ - The application was denied
  * __approval_accepted__- The approval has been accepted by the applicant
  * __rejected__ - The approval was rejected by the applicant
  * __canceled__ - The application has been canceled
  * __expired__ - The application has expired

status_message.description: An optional message further describing the status of the lease application.

lease_id.description: The id of the corresponding lease that is created when the lease application is accepted by the applicant(s).  This field will be null until accepted.

applicant_1.description: The primary individual applying for a lease.

reference_1.description: The first reference for the applicant(s)

reference_2.description: The second reference for the applicant(s)

routing_number.description: Applicant's or applicants' bank account routing number.  Must be a valid 9-digit routing number

account_number.description: Applicant's or applicants' checking account routing number.  This must be a checking account.  Savings and other types of accounts are not acceptable.  Must be between 3 and 16 digits

account_type.description: Applicant's or applicants' bank account type.  The only valid type is "checking"

auto_approved_amount.description: The amount the applicant(s) has been approved for on a lease.

conditional_approved_amount.description: An amount greater than the auto_approved_amount that the applicant(s) has been conditionally approved, pending additional underwriting items are provided by the applicant.

approval_accepted_at.description: The date and time at which the applicant accepted the approved lease application

Lease Application.description: A lease application, containing information about the applicant (or applicants), approval status and approval details.  A lease is generated from a lease application on acceptance by the applicant.

employer_phone.description: Phone number of the applicant's employer.  Must be at least 10 digits.

employment_net_monthly_income.description: Applicant's net monthly income in USD.

hired_on.description: Date applicant was hired by the employer. MM/YYYY

income_types.description: The type of income received for the this employment

next_payday_on.description: Date applicant will next be paid.

pay_frequency.description: How often the applicant is paid.

Employment Information.description: Captures information about an applicant's employment.

name.description: Full name of the reference for the applicant(s).

phone.description: Phone number for the person acting as a reference.

Lease Application Reference.description: An individual acting as a reference for a lease applicant or applicants.

extra.description: An arbitrary object that can be sent back.  It may the object passed in the request, null, or something else altogether

messages.description: One or more messages describing the causes of the error

status.description: An overall status for the request

any_undelivered_items.description: Any undelivered items that are listed on the Merchant Agreement

leaseId.description: The id of the lease that this delivery confirmation belongs to

Delivery Confirmation.description: Captures information about a delivery confirmation.
